As long as you hold on the the pain, you are allowing them to cause you pain, anger, hate and become resentful and miserable.
Accept what they have done, accept that there is nothing that they can do to change what they did. They did it, that’s it. It’s done. They can’t undo it. Forgive them by accepting what they did. Don’t forget what they did. Forgiveness isn’t saying that it’s okay to do what they did. Your not approving of their behavior, your just accepting what they did and they can’t undo it. You don’t need to tell them you’ve forgiving them. It’s best to not to have any communication with someone who’s caused you pain. Forgiveness is done from your heart. It’s done for you and not for them. This takes no responsibility away from them and their actions. Forgiveness is for you. So you can let them go and move on with your life in a healthy way. You will be free of the pain and all the ugly anger and hate.It’s a wonderful and satisfying feeling to be free. Forgiveness is much more satisfying than a confrontation. A confrontation solves nothing. It causes more ill feelings with everyone. Forgiveness takes away your pain and empowers you. Letting go allows you to me in control of your emotions. You don’t gave to live in that hurt any longer.

questionText: A good friend suddenly resents me with no explanation .I 've been abruptly cut off from communication .This person means a lot to me ,but I fear a hostile reaction if I proceed any further .Is it better to mend the relationship or to accept the loss
answerText: You could write a card that says “Hey, maybe it’s just me but I’ve noticed you and I are not the same anymore. You mean a lot to me. I am sorry for anything I have said or done that offended you. If you ever feel up to it, I will sit and listen to you so I can understand better what I can do in order to be accountable and a better friend” ….. so with that you will need to listen and the truth will come out either way you’ll understand in a short period of time the real value of the relationship.

questionText: My friend always argues with me in each and every issue he always tries to prove me wrong how should I react to him
answerText:
He seems like an attention-seeker. He seeks arguments over anything, so he can verbally spar with someone so they can pay him attention.
He's insecure. He feels the need to always prove himself to others. Him pointing out other's faults, makes him feel like he has none.He's immature.. And he sure isn't your "friend" .Rid him from your life

questionText: How do I avoid friend during exams
answerText:
Study at home when you can.
 Try the library for a quiet study session.
 Go to a coffee shop for a change of scenery.
 Create a study plan to stay focused.
 Change your phone and computer settings.
try to avoid using phone

questionText: How can I break my exam fear
answerText: In most cases, exam stress is caused by the fear of failing an exam and it can also be caused by: Low motivation levels. Lack of preparation and planning. High expectations from others. To Overcome:Early revision Make your timetable Have a plan ready Prepare notes Take breaks Sleep well

questionText: Why do I forget everything during a test?
answerText: When we experience short-term stress as a result of test anxiety, our brain activates a fight or flight response. This affects memory by inhibiting the prefrontal cortex, which is the area of our brain responsible for retrieval. As a result, we can not remember, during that moment, what we learned previously.

questionText: My friends got higher marks than me I feel inferior.What should I do
answerText:
Well thats completely normal and typical human behaviour to be jealous of somebody who does better than us.
What you need to ask yourself is what is it that you can do about it apart from feeling inferior. That does not serve any purpose whatsoever, apart from reducing your self confidence and making you more angry.
So what do you do? First make your own standards and stop comparing yourself to somebody else. They have their own destiny and luck and you have to create your own. Next time have a plan in place. Study smart and get help with taking/making notes and memory skills so that you are confident about writing the paper. Do the best you can.
Instead of feeling inferior, use it as power to do well for yourself. Remember everybody is good at something and you need to find what your strengths are before you focus on your weaknesses.

questionText: Why I feel to much possessive about my friend
answerText:
Discuss this with your friend. Since you said she is your best friend share the problem which is bothering you,don’t dwell on it alone.Hope she understands and takes it positively.
Things you should do to overcome this:
Don’t focus your entire energy on one person,that is one bad thing people like us do.Distribute it . Do some creative stuff.If you enjoy your own company like you said you don’t have much people to mix up,invest that time in exploring your hobbies and interests.Depending on one person for your entire happiness is not a good idea,it never was.
Give priority to the peace of your mind.Even after giving everything its ambiguous that whether that person will stay in your life or not, its better to move on.
Understand the fact truly that few people need to be socially active because it is a part of their personality.
Make the above mentioned things your habit and part of your personality.

questionText: How do I stop being overcommitted
answerText:
Examine your schedule and available time. Sit down with your calendar and list all of your responsibilities, as well as your routine and mandatory activities. Include your classes, lab work, study time, work schedule, practicum, family activities, and time for self-care and social events. Keep in mind that it's often easy to underestimate your time constraints.
Survey and prioritize. After looking over your schedule, determine if you have already taken on too much. Can you scale back any of your activities to free up more time for new opportunities? Decide what is realistic and what is most important to you in light of your existing obligations.
Avoid last-minute commitments. While a calendar can serve as a useful visual reminder of standing and upcoming events, too many blank spaces may tempt you to fill them quickly with new activities. Before taking on another obligation, be sure to obtain a good description of what will be expected of you and the time investment. Consider how the new activity will contribute to your development and if it's in-line with your goals. Be sure to set aside time in your schedule for rest and relaxation. Days reserved "just for you" or "just for family" are as important as everything else!
Say "no" and "yes" and mean it. Learning to say no can be a very difficult thing to do, particularly for students who want to stand out among a cohort of other high-achieving and talented individuals. People that you don't see or interact with on a regular basis may not realize the full extent of your time commitments. When your schedule is already pushing its maximum capacity, it's not only permissible, but important, to say no and to feel comfortable setting limits.
Before committing to something new, take some time to think about the implications, so that if you do agree to take it on you can perform to the best of your abilities and be absolutely certain you can follow through. The first few times you have to turn down an exciting opportunity may feel awkward or unsettling. But it's much better for awkward or unsettling. But it's much better for you and your reputation to do a few things exceedingly well, than a lot of things in a mediocre way.

questionText: My parents don't love me much due to my poor grades and I too have begun to hate them. I almost have no friends. How should I deal with my loneliness?

questionText: How do I make my strict parents happy
answerText:
Do not talk back or disrespect them. If you cannot do something, let them know in a calm manner.
Communicate with your parents if something changes. If you have a set curfew and you cannot make it or would like to stay out, let them know ahead of time instead of just disobeying.
Always listen.

questionText: How do I stop being scared of reality
answerText:
Identify your fears.
Embrace your fears.
Disidentify with your fears.
Understand your worst-case scenario.
Do a reality check of your worst-case scenario.
Develop a fearless focus.

questionText: How do I convince my strict parents to let me go out with my friends
answerText: If your parents cannot trust you, they will not let you out of their sight.Try building truth, honesty, and sticking to rules of the home.Let them also meet your friends.If they don't trust your friends, they will not want you with them.Be where you say you will be, come home at the set time and if you are going to be late, call and let them know as soon as possible.Lying will keep you in the house longer, start telling the truth.If your peers easily influence you, they will not let you out.If your friends do not care about the rules and regulations at their homes, they will not care at yours.Make sure your friends follow the house rule at your house, that will show your parents that they are respectful.

questionText: How to convince your parents to get a bike
answerText:
Be very specific and tell your family that you need a bike for your daily commuting or other.
Tell your parents how it can help your daily life or job and save time & money.
Assure them about your riding capability, the obedience of street law, and government regulations.

questionText: My mom hates the idea of having a dog no matter what I say to persuade her. Should I just stop asking?
answerText: Actually your mom is not hating the idea of having a dog, she is hating for what comes after you get a dog. Getting a dog or puppy is easy but raising a puppy is different. It's takes a lot of hard work and patience to raise a puppy. You have to take care of that puppy just like a new born baby. From feeding , vaccination, to cleaning it's potty. That are really some tough work. You have to give proper time for your puppy. Since you will be out from your house for many reasons, it's your mother who has to take care of him in your absence. And once it becomes a member of your house, if anything happens to him it is really painful to watch him suffer. If you can persuade your mother that you will take proper care of that puppy and give your 100% maybe then your mother can agree. Try not to think from your point of view, understand your mother's point of view too. She is already taking care of the family. Getting a puppy will increase her work load.

questionText: How can I stop feeling like an inconvenience for everyone
answerText:
The strange thing is, if you feel like an inconvenience for everyone, you will be. The energy you emit while in this pathetic headspace can be felt by the ones around you. It is a burden for everyone, yourself obviously included. Let’s try to get you into a different headspace.
You’re living through a shitty stage in your life? You’re allowed to. These happen to everyone. You are allowed to feel like crap and wallow in misery. But just know while you’re visiting this awful place you will not be much fun to be around. Yes, a bit of an inconvenience. But know it is not forever! This too shall pass, my friend. What a humbling experience. Take it as such.
When you pop out the other end, you will have so much more respect for the loved ones who helped you through. The ones who accepted your inconvenience. That’s what friends and family are for. We are all inconveniences during one time or another in our lives. That’s what going through rough patches looks like. Don’t hate on yourself. Just be there for someone else in return when they are wallowing in misery.

questionText: I am very poor in time management skills
answerText: Sometimes procrastination is the direct result of poor time management. If so, the tips given in the "Time Management" section should help. Other times, procrastination is caused by poor self-care (e.g., not enough sleep, poor diet, no exercise).People struggle with time management for many reasons. It may be as simple as a lack of clearly defined goals. Even if you know how to plan and schedule, a lack of clear direction can make it difficult to know where to focus. Breakdown Every Task Into Small Chunks.Practice Decision Making.

questionText: Why do I get scared after watching a scary movie?
answerText: It's all about what happens in the body when we're watching scary movies. During horror movies, our brains release adrenaline, which prepares our bodies for stressful situations. Our sympathetic nervous system responds to the threat and throws us into the "fight or flight" response.

questionText: Why do depressed people watch horror?
answerText: Sometimes, rather than a way to escape real-life worries, horror can be a way to dive headfirst into them -- almost like a form of exposure therapy. questionText: Why do I behave like a character after watching a movie?
answerText: Mirroring is the behaviour in which one person subconsciously imitates the gesture , speech pattern, or attitude of another. Mirroring often occurs in social situations, particularly in the company of close friends or family.

questionText: Is it normal to be attracted to villains?
answerText: People are attracted to villains who are similar to themselves — but only when they are fictional. New research suggests that people are attracted to negative versions of themselves, so long as their self-concept is not under threat. This finding comes from a study published in Psychological Science.

questionText: Why do we romanticize villains?
answerText: Using actors and actresses that are widely considered attractive to play villains may increase profits for the movie, but it may also normalize dangerous behaviors. They commercialize evil, romanticize abusive relationships and make the villain sought after.

questionText: Why am I attention-seeking?
answerText: Attention-seeking behavior may stem from jealousy, low self-esteem, loneliness, or as a result of a personality disorder. If you notice this behavior in you or someone else, a mental health professional can provide diagnosis and treatment options.

questionText: How do I stop being attention-seeking?
answerText: If being an attention seeker is ruining your relationships, focus more on yourself instead of trying to impress everyone. Instead of saying or doing things to bring attention to others, use another outlet to express your creativity like writing, painting, playing music, arts and crafts, or singing.

questionText: Why do I always argue with my siblings?
answerText: Siblings fight because they're hungry, tired, bored, or they want Mom and Dad's attention. Sometimes they squabble because they're simply sick of spending so much time together. Among younger children, sibling fighting might occur because they don't know the proper way to express what's bothering them.

questionText: I get so anxious when I'm in a crowd as I begin to wonder what would they be thinking about my appearance.How should I stop this
answerText: Dress right: when you wear like a smart person you seem like a smart person. and i don’t mean that you should wear suit all the time, i just mean that you should not be shabby.Know and be proud of your strength: so what if you are a little fat, of skinny or not attractive, remember that you are a superior beings who excel in his/her field of interest.Work Hard: now you might ask “what it’s got to do with insecurity”, well let me tell you, when you start doing something productive, example, writing a poem, learning a language, drawing etc, you stop thinking about small things and can concentrate on things that matter.Don’t be ashamed of your insecurities : there are many people in the world who cant walk, have terminal illness, are too poor to have 2 meals a day, people who doesn’t have family, brothers, and friends. And you are insecure just because you might look unattractive to someone.

questionText: why do I love comfort zone
answerText: A comfort zone is a place in which you probably do not experience a lot of anxiety, because, to you, it's familiar ground. A comfort zone is relatively predictable and safe, so you don't have to worry about threats and unpleasant surprises all the time. Human beings build comfort zones everywhere they arrive

questionText: why do I feel lonely sometimes ,even though I have so many friends
answerText:
You have friends? Woah! Great!
But my dear, that doesn’t really matter.
You wanna know how? Let me tell you. Friends can hang out with you, chat with you, talk over phone call or come at your home for a while. Isn’t it? You cannot be with your friends 24×7. And when you’re not there with them physically, you feel lonely. Isn’t it.
So, they are probably not your real friends. They are just your past time buddies. And the reason that they aren’t your real friends is that, if they really were your friends then even if you don’t meet them or don’t talk to them for days, you wouldn’t be feeling lonely, because you would know that no matter i have anybody else with you or not, but my friend is always there for me. But you don’t feel this, do you?
The irony is, in this generation of our’s everybody is stuck up in showoff and hiding their real selves. In the evening, they’ll be hanging out with ample number of people but when they’ll be at home, alone in their room at night, they’ll be the same loneliest person.
So, the more number of friends only show that how much you are surrounded by people in life. But number doesn’t matter. Even if you have just a single person with you who lifts you up, be there whenever you need them, tries to know you more, motivates you and helps you face difficult situation, then you are lucky enough not to feel lonely ever.
And one thing i want to tell you if you don’t find such friend is that you don’t depend on any person to take away your loneliness and make you feel happy, you yourself hold the power to identify and how to maintain your inner peace.
Hope this helps :) Don’t think too much. Everyone is lonely in one or the other way.

questionText: Why do we feel that others are leading a better life than us?
answerText:
We feel that others are leading better lives that us because we see their perfect lives all over the social media. People upload travel pictures, wedding pictures, going on outings with their friends, buying a new car, or accomplishing their best goals.
When we see such pictures on social media it makes us believe that they are living their dream lives.
But the sad part is.Either all of it is fake.Or, we never actually see the hard work that goes into others lives to get there. We just see the tip of the iceberg.
No one puts up their hardships, their sadness, their worst days on social media for people to see. But trust me, everybody has those.
Happiness is a choice. You can simply be happy with what you have or you will keep being sad seeing others even though you have everything you currently need. We end up comparing our lives with others. But to be honest, lives can't be compared. Everyone has their own journeys and own battles to live through.
At these times, when we feel we aren't happy, I guess we should look around and see the little things that we have being avoiding, which are special to us, something we're lucky to have. And appreciate it. Every. Day.
Also I believe nobody is ever totally happy. We humans are never satisfied with what we have. We always keep wanting other things and when we have that we want more other things. We never appreciate we just want more than what we have. Always. Which can be good and bad too. It's good to have a goal but what's the point if you don't appreciate what you have now and how hard you worked to get it.
So I guess our goals should be contentment not happiness. Because once we're content and satisfied, we will indeed stop comparing our lives with others

questionText: How do I get rid of jealousy
answerText:
I want you to understand that it's okay to feel jealous. Everyone feels jealous at some point in their life. We don't have to feel bad for feeling jealous !! It's very normal !
First, we need to know from where does jealousy come?
Jealousy comes the moment we compare ourselves with others !!!
It takes a lot of effort to stop comparing ourselves with others. It is almost impossible.
There is something we forget in the process of comparing ourselves“Normally, we compare every part of us to the one best part of everyone “
And this is completely illogical. Noone knows all 360° about someone. Even our parents don’t know us completely .Everyone has their own amount of strengths and weakness. Because we see only the best part of others doesn't make us any lesser than them.
Secondly, how to get rid of jealousy ?
There is a popular saying, “ you persist what you resistWe don't feel bad for positive emotions like happiness ,excitement, joyous etc. But we have this urge to escape our bad emotions like sadness, anger, frustration, jealousy etc.
Humans are emotional animals. We are bound to get both positive and negative emotions. It is important to let them flow through us rather than bottling up inside or trying to get rid of it. The only way to get rid of jealousy is to feel it. Listen to it. All those words and images coming out of the situation is the talk of your jealous body . You are not connected to it or identifying with it. We are humans and this is our ego self disguised as jealous body that do the talking. The moment we become aware of jealous body is the moment we dissociate with it !! We become jealous free!

questionText: Is it normal to feel uncomfortable around everyone, even family? What causes this?
answerText: Anxiety. It is not normal in the population. It is normal for you, and it is a normal response from humans to their various physical and psychological environments and mindsets. It is caused by an inner discomfort with yourself: If you are uncomfortable in your own skin, you are uncomfortable around others who see you and affirm your existence, like a magnifying glass makes everything more clear and big. The problem is your attitude / feelings toward yourself. When you can change your mindset and opinion of yourself to feel good about yourself and who you are, you’ll find there is no discomfort in being around anyone else.

questionText: What could cause someone to feel completely disconnected from everything?
answerText:
Disconnection starts early on in life, particularly if you’ve been subjected to emotional neglect, abuse or have been raised as an extension of a parent. Painful experience (however it comes) will cause a person to disassociate or disconnect from the source of that pain. This has its corollary in reality - we disconnect, not only from ourselves (our pain), but from other people (society) as well.
Yet somehow, the act of disassociation has the effect of making us feel guilty and to blame.
As we grow, the disassociation turns on us, giving us the idea that WE are being rejected (not the other way around). You feel you are the one who is isolated and lonely when in fact it was you who did the rejecting (for very good reasons). You did it for survival. You did it because you couldn’t relate to the people who were hurting you.
The time has come for you to trust again and return to life.

questionText: What can I do to become smarter?
answerText:
Be punctual because unpunctual people don't achieve much in their career.
You don't have to say yes to everything, sometimes you have to say no & don't shy away from doing it.
Learn from people who achieved what you want to achieve.
Have a open mind towards everything, with a close mind you won't be able to see things.
Read books, watch podcast & see how your thought process changes.
Play sports, it will teach you teamwork & it's very important in both job & business.
Listen more. I hardly speak for a minute or two over call & listen to other person & that person ends up saying I had best conversation with you however sometimes you have to speak more.
You can't be in good books of everyone, so don't stress much if someone bad mouths you even if it wasn't your mistake.

questionText: How do I train my brain to think better
answerText:
Instead of changing your attitude about life or reading books, consider spending time to develop better core cognitive skills.

Unlike getting tutoring or just studying more, this effort improves the basic mental components that support the overall thinking process. Functions like visual and auditory processing, working and long-term memory, attention & focus, logic & reasoning and processing speed to name a few. A weakness in any single one of those areas can thwart a person's overall ability to learn. When those things get better a person has increased confidence in approaching unfamiliar things, allowing them to make more considered choices in their responses.

For example, often a person who struggles merely has a problem with properly hearing spoken language. Sure they can hear words and know their meanings but if they have a hard time processing the input fast enough they might not be able to recognize and make proper sense of them. One might say it is like not being used to a thick accent. If you can't get the words it doesn't matter how smart you are, you won't have all the data necessary to interpret the situation. Or maybe it's like not knowing enough of the slang or jargon. Incomplete or bad data can leave you confused, especially if you have an inkling you're missing something. Kinda hard to think clearly when that happens.

Anyway, that's just one example. You can imagine other ways thinking becomes difficult, like when you have poor working memory. If you can't keep track of the data you can't make consistently accurate conclusions. Again, you might be aware of that problem and anxiety & self-doubt can build over it thus inhibiting your thought process even more.

All those things I listed above work together to support higher level thinking - and they're applicable on a global level, not just being able to do math problems in your head or make snappy comments in the moment. Getting better input from all your senses gives you much better materials for your brain to work with when thinking about pretty much anything.

Another way to improve your thinking is to change your approach to listening or reading. Listening to understand rather than listening to reply is better in the long run.

questionText: Mom don't support for buying dog
answerText:
Mom must have her reasons for not wanting a dog… ask her what her reasons are.
If they are financial.. a dog costs money to feed and care for (veterinary expenses)… then she has a very valid concern. Are you willing and able to help with these expenses?
If your Mom believes she will be responsible for the care of the dog ( feeding, training, picking up poop) .. are you willing to be responsible for that?
If she doesn’t like dogs or fears dogs… how are you going to help her overcome her fears.
Is it possible mom is allergic to dogs? She may be open to a dog breed that doesn’t have fur and shed…. Like a Poodle or Shih Tzu.
Are dogs not allowed where you live (if you are in a rental you may not be able to have one.)
Finally if she does agree, make sure you find a breed or a rescue dog that will fit with your family. It may well be you mom has valid reasons for not wanting a dog. You’re going to have to step up and overcome her concerns. That’s the best way to convince her! Hope this helps.

questionText: How can I convince my mother to let me cut my haoir as short as I want?She says i will look like a boy,but honestly I dont care.I'm 14 and I really want to experiment,especially with alternative styles
answerText: She can’t make decisions for you for the rest of your life, and you’ll never learn if you don’t learn to think things through and live with the results. It is better to learn through thought-experiments than trial and error. There are advantages to short hair, especially in maintenance and time-saving. Worst-case scenario it will grow back even if you do not like it. Or you discover it is much more convenient and that becomes the new you, not so worried about investing in hair, but in personal development that matters. It’s better that she let you learn for yourself on something with NO real lasting results, otherwise you’ll be ill-prepared to make any real decisions anyway. She can’t dictate who she wants you to be forever, you’re not a dress-up doll for an old woman to play with, or try to live through vicariously. One of these days, you’re going to have to make choices that mattter, sex, tattoos, etc. Hair will grow back, you’re the one that’s got to deal with that hassle and there are reasons that longer hair is impractical. you should not have to suffer investing time in something unproductive, because hair is taking away from time that could be used much more wisely, such as studying, exercising, damn near anything. Being a prissy little beauty queen is not going to get you that far in life really. If she’s going to flip out and go batshit crazy, just appease her until you have the first opportunity to get on your own. Because really, you cannot win a battle with a fruitcake mother that is unwilling to let go of her little princess fantasy. You have to pick and choose your battles wisely—in a few more years, you’ll be an adult legally, and you can do whatever you want. It’s not that far away. I like long hair, but I’m not the one that has to wash and comb that rat’s nest everyday.

questionText: I am a very shy person how do I become confident
answerText:
Don’t label yourself as “shy” — You are just in the process of improving your social skills.
Start talking to people. Step-out of your comfort zone.
Relive anxiety. Have tips and tricks to overcome your anxiety. Example — naming all the things you see around you.
Don’t think too much. You should say what you feel like saying. Trust me, it won’t be absurd.
Have fun. The more fun you are having the more people will tend to like you.
Take care of yourself. Build your self-esteem by doing things that are good for you.
Listen carefully. When people tell yourself about themselves, really care and listen to what they say.

questionText: How can I be social with everybody
answerText:
Smile at everybody
Stop judging people and being a critic
Learn people's names and use it
Ask them the small stuff. Ask how they doing. About their weekend. Talk about the weather and family.
Ask them the big stuff. What motivates them. Why they do what they do. How they think. What they would love to do.
Be interested in them and listen to their stories.
Give people compliments and acknowledgement of whatever they did right.
When they greet you, don't shrug them off. Smile, talk to them and share your story.
Watch some comedy and practice telling jokes. Also learn how to laugh at others peoples jokes. Be free, have fun.
Don't argue with people.
Go out of your house.

questionText: How can I force myself to be happy
answerText:
Manage your stress levels.Get enough sleep. Enjoy yourself. ...
Boost your self-esteem.
Have a healthy lifestyle.
Talk and share. 
Build your resilience.

questionText: why do I just think all day
answerText: While overthinking itself is not a mental illness, it is associated with conditions including depression, anxiety, eating disorders and substance use disorders. Rumination can be common in people who have chronic pain and chronic illness as well, taking the form of negative thoughts about that pain and healing from it.

questionText: I'm tired of my dad always criticising or insulting me. I've really had enough. College is my only true home now. I'm so confused. What do I do?
answerText: If your dad criticizes you too much, you shut him down with “if what you're saying is true, you fucked up as a parent". You are a reflection of his parenting. But chances are, he's using you as his emotional toilet. You don't have to play that game. You can lessen contact, withdraw emotionally, and begin to heal yourself. All kids are wired to need the love and approval of their parents. If the parents are too self absorbed, then the kids need to distance themselves and validate themselves in spite of their parents. This is how you heal. You say fuck them I'm a rockstar. And go on with your bad self. It's not easy letting go of that need for love and approval, but its necessary in order to heal.

questionText: How do I deal with an unsupportive dad?
answerText: our own understanding of what is or isn't appropriate/ right. You can't change him and attempting to will expend a lot of energy that you need for yourself and managing your own life. Its only going to drive you crazy. Look for more objective viewpoints if he's the type who is very judgmental.

questionText: My dad always tries to pick fights with me out of no reason and blames me for our very bad distant relationship. What should I do?
answerText: Don't allow his negativity in your life. I cut ties with my parents and most of my family because of some serious reasons. This would be one of the lesser reasons. If they can't build you up then take yourself out of the equation. Negativity is toxic and unfullfilling in your life. If you live with him distance yourself. Obviously he won't be a grown ass adult and take any responsibility for his end of things.

questionText: My dad is rather mean and he acts like a dictator. He uses the excuse, " I pay for the house. I feed you. I give you clothes. I give you a bed. I pay for everything here, so you should shut up." Is this a reasonable argument?
answerText:
It's not a “reasonable" argument. Your dad is a piece of shit, to put it bluntly. It's his OBLIGATION to provide those things, since he found it necessary to put his dick in your mother. Honestly though, his only requirements are to provide food, shelter, clothing, and an appropriate education; being his child doesn't make you entitled to anything but basic NECESSITIES.
I suggest that if there is actual abuse, reporting it to Child Protective Services. If your mother isn't with him anymore, but you're a 13-year-old or older, contact her and see if she'll take you in, or even your grandparents or an aunt ans/or uncle. These people may be very aware of his handling of things and it might very well be in your best interest to move away. If it gets taken to court, your and their testimony can be enough to get you away from him, abs chances are, since he regrets having you, it'll likely not get that far, and if it does, he likely won't contest it.
I can't actually speak to his reaction, because you could be a totally self-centered, entitled price, but if you're not, I hope you get away asap. Talk to your mom or another family member, be honest, and be safe.

questionText: why am I interested in anything
answerText: Sometimes it might be because you are just feeling uninspired. In other cases, it might mean that you've lost interest in some of your old hobbies and need to explore some new passions. But sometimes this feeling can be a sign of a mental health condition such as depression.

questionText: Can mindfulness make you happier?
answerText: Mindfulness can make you happier by helping you be “in the moment” more often. It’s easy to spend hours—or days or years—ruminating on past mistakes. It’s equally easy to spend hours worrying about the future. Mindfulness helps you be present with the moment and yourself.

questionText: Am wasting my time by doing nothing.how do I create a morning routine for sucess
answerText:
Find your “why” – when things get tough, you need to have a good reason to keep going.
Start small and build slowly – don’t aim for perfection. Aim for realistic and achievable.
Commit to consistency – nothing will work without consistency over the long-haul.
Plan ahead – find ways to make t easier by removing distractions and setting up cues.
Create balance – design a good morning routine by including behaviors from all four areas of self-improvement: mental, physical, emotional, and spiritual.

questionText: Can I talk my problems with others

questionText: why do I share my problems more with my friends than my family

questionText: What personal things should you never share with a friend?
answerText:
Your past mistakes, no matter how big they are, which don’t affect your present or future, especially in relation to that person. Most will make fun of you, mock you, or spread that word. A little expression would make alive your dead miseries. With your life partner, still your choice.
Your biggest of luxuries, things which you have gotten through fate or have been put in your lap by birth. More you show off, more you will attract frauds and cons, also people will feel jealous of you, which won't be great for you.
Someone else’s critical information which they have shared in good faith. No matter how frustrated you feel to share the word, just remind yourself that it will ruin your image in the front of the person you are sharing someone else secret, they would never trust you, also of the information gets leaked, the person who's information was leaked would break all ties with you.
Secrets which have the capacity to ruin your life, or cause you harm and embarrassment and may be used against you in the future. A few words and countless moments of fear and insecurity.
Your biggest of flaws, keep them to yourself or others will use them for their betterment or for using you.
Your biggest of dreams, the crazy imaginations. People will only demotivate you, show you practically and make fun of you, because obviously, your goals are too big to digest.
Strange emotions, contradictory emotions, like feeling bad for your enemy, or feeling bad despite achieving a dream, feeling bad after ditching a negative person, such second thoughts ought to be, but sharing them will only make people fin of you.

questionText: Which are the things I need to keep private?
answerText:
Anything that if someone has shared something with you in confidence. Keep that secret to your deathbed.
You're future goals/ambitions until they are achieved. Your Big Plan. The more go you around screaming your goals the fewer chances are that you are going to achieve them.
How much do you earn? It's quite simple actually. It's none of the other people business.
Your relationship details/issues. You two should solve and sort it out. No third opinion matters.
Your weakness. Be careful before confiding your feelings to anyone. Not everyone who presents you as a friend is a trustworthy person.
Political Inclinations and Religious views.
Your belongings. No one is interested in listening to bragging about your belongings. It is better to keep them secret.
